title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code is amended to redesignate subsections and adjust the rate of payment for benefits, excluding certain cases. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code is amended to adjust the rate of payment for benefits under the Veterans Benefits and Health Care Improvement Act of 2000. Subsection (b) is further amended to specify payment conditions. The rate of payment for benefits under the Veterans Benefits and Health Care Improvement Act of 2000 is adjusted. Payments are specified in subsection (b) with amendments regarding effective dates for benefits. The rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans is amended to include benefits under chapter 13 of title 38. This amendment will take effect on the date of enactment of the Act and apply to benefits paid for months starting from that date. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF CERTAIN FILIPINO VETERANS FOR DISABILITY PENSION. Amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, expands eligibility criteria by including subsections (c), (d), and (e) and chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15 of this title. Amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code expands eligibility criteria by including subsections (c), (d), and (e) and chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15 of this title. Additionally, a new subsection (e) is added for benefits under chapter 15. The amendment to Section 107 of title 38, United States Code expands eligibility criteria by including subsections (c), (d), and (e) and chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15 of this title. A new subsection (e) is added for benefits under chapter 15, specifying conditions for payment to individuals residing in the United States. The amendment expands eligibility criteria for benefits under title 38, United States Code. Benefits paid to individuals in the United States or the Republic of the Philippines are subject to specific conditions. The amendments take effect upon enactment of the Act. The amendment expands eligibility criteria for benefits under title 38, United States Code. Benefits paid to individuals in the Republic of the Philippines are set at $100 per month. The amendments take effect upon enactment of the Act. The eligibility of Filipino veterans for health care in the United States is expanded under section 1734 of title 38, United States Code. Hospital, nursing home care, and medical services are provided to Commonwealth Army veterans and new Philippine Scouts. Additionally, outpatient health care is available for veterans residing in the Philippines. The Secretary will provide outpatient care and services for World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts residing in the Philippines for their service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities. The Secretary will provide outpatient care and services to World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts residing in the Philippines for their service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities, with a limit of $500,000 expenditure per fiscal year. The Secretary will provide outpatient care and services to World War II veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts residing in the Republic of the Philippines at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with a limit of $500,000 expenditure per fiscal year. The amendments made by this section regarding outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines will take effect upon the enactment of this Act.
